danish_publication: Når man forhen vilde fange en nisse, brugtes følgende fremgangsmåde: Man gik ud i skoven for at fælde træer. Ved lyden af et træes fald kom æ nisser løbende, alt hvad de kunde, for at se, hvordan folkene bar sig ad med det, og de satte sig da ved siden af dem og snakkede med dem både om det ene og det andet. Folk vilde den gang gjærne have en nisse i deres huse, for de vilde da gjærne fange én. Når de så kilede træet ud, traf det så tit, at nissens lille hale kom ned i sprækken, og når de så stræbte at få kilen ud, sad halen i klemme. Så var nis fangen, og på den måde fangede man mange nisser i gamle dage.
english_publication: When one wanted to catch a nisse, one would use the following procedure: One went out into the woods to cut down trees. With the sound of the falling tree, the nisser would come running as fast as they could to see how people managed that and they’d sit down next to them and would talk to them about both this and that. People at that time wanted to have a nisse in their house, and so they wanted to catch one. Then when they’d wedge the tree out, it often happened that the nisse’s little tail would get caught in the chink and then when they’d try to get the tail out, it would be caught. Then the nis was caught and in that way they caught a lot of nisser in the old days.
